faq.text1: It's a mobile & desktop site that allows technical resources that want to join technology startups to register and get discovered.
faq.text2: If you are a A) technical person and B) want to be a cofounder in a tech startup, register so non technical founders looking for “CTOs” can find you and reach out to you.
faq.text3: Yes, its 100% free to register and search, it's our contribution to a better tech ecosystem
faq.title4: If it's free how will it be sustainable
faq.text4: We will eventually accept donation and sponsors for imateco.com, the same model as Wikipedia
faq.title5: Will my profile be visible after I register?
faq.text5: Yes, we had to make sure that people looking for a technical cofounder can just search profiles without having to register.  This way we keep the user base of imateco focused on what it really should be , technical talent that has a desire to join a startup.
faq.title7: Will there be other languages than Arabic and English?
faq.text7: The site is done intentionally to allow for other languages , but we made a decision to launch in English as the common denominator and also Arabic.
faq.title8: Will I find my cofounder on imateco?
faq.text8: Maybe, it's actually harder to find the right co-founder than to get accepted into Stanford (Acceptance into Stanford is ~5%) , identifying a getting along with a co founder takes months, and a lot of coffees and late night discussions.  You will not just contact someone on imateco and expect that A) they will want to join you or B) they are the right technical resource as a CTO for your startups.  imateco is the starting point, the first step in a thousand steps to get a technical cofounder.
faq.title9: I’m a technical person, and i wanna be a cofounder, and I registered , how do I make sure I get contacted?
faq.text9:
The first issue is tactical,  and it is related to your registered email, when you register via email, LinkedIn, or Twitter, make sure you use an account that you regularly use, because when someone contacts you on the site, that contact goes in the form of an email to your register email. 
The second issue is your profile, you need to sell yourself, make sure you go after registration and complete your profile, fill in great content in the “Tell us more about yourself” section, this is where you can shin and differentiate your profile than the others, a complete profile simply gets more contact requests.
faq.title10: Why didn't you make the site registration by invite only to filter for quality?
faq.text10:
For two reasons, the first is who are we to judge if you are good or not.   Some of the registered users could be junior developers that turn out to be amazing cofounders, it's not our role to decide who is good and who is not , all we are doing is giving visibility to technical people that want to become co founders. 
The second reason is that the really good CTOs already are co founders or have amazing jobs, and the really really good ones already have startups, so we are not worried about that category, we want to give a change to the many many technical talents that just do not have visibility.
faq.title12: I can only see a select list of countries at registration?
faq.text12: Yes that is correct, we are rolling imateco.com out to a select countries for now since phase I of the goal is to connect potential founders together, and wanted to minimize distance as a factor.  Of course once we demonstrate that imateco is needed, we will be allowing registration from other regions.
faq.title13: Will you provide us content to what makes a great cofounder and what are the typical equity percentages etc..?
faq.text13: Yes, we are planning to start publishing best practice guidelines that are related to co founders and team building, team psychology and typical compensation.  And if you have any useful material please share it with us
faq.text14: We hope not, we want to make sure that the people that are registering are genuine and really want to become technical cofounders in a startup.
faq.title15: Why do I need a technical co-founder?
faq.text15: Technical startups are based on the in-house technical skills and abilities of the founders, as it creates a durable base for the startup and ensures longevity. One of the criterias startups must have is the involvement of at least one technical partner and one business partner, a doer and a seller.

home.are_you_looking: Are you looking for a technical cofounder?

about_us.paragraph1: Hello and thank you for visiting imateco.com, which stands for I’m a technical co-founder. The idea behind imateco came from seeing a very big pain over and over again when reviewing MENA based technology startups.  A good percentage of these startups are by amazing founders, but single founders, and of those, the founder is typically not technical.
about_us.paragraph2: As we all know best startups are made up of a complementary team of a “seller” and a “doer”, by doer we mean a CTO. This is where the idea behind imateco was born.
about_us.paragraph3: imateco.com is simply a site for technical people that want to join as co-founders in technology startups to sign up and get approached by founders. Its that simple, imateco.com is a database of techies that have raised their hand and said "hey, i’d like to be a co-founder in a technology startup".
about_us.paragraph4: If you have any suggestions and you want to partner with us on spreading the word, please don't hesitate to reach out to me on twitter at https://twitter.com/mzu3bi.
about_us.paragraph5: Special thanks to our partners and to the people listed below, without them we would not have this effort:
about_us.paragraph7: Abdullah Alaraj, My partner in crime at Nama Ventures
about_us.paragraph8: Mazen Alzaidi, who bugged me everyday to launch imateco.com
about_us.paragraph9: Waleed Alballa. My great sounding board.
about_us.paragraph10: Deema Alyaha. For being a great advocate of the project and connecting us with many technical talent.
about_us.paragraph11: Ahmad Alfozan. Who is always available to offer a lending hand in anything that empowers our tech ecosystem.
